intro: Kadua cordata var. laxa, commonly known as the slender heartleaf kadua, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
